meanings.definition: To hit a golf ball awkwardly, causing it to travel a short distance.
meanings.sent1: He tends to sclaff his shots, making them fall short.
meanings.sent2: Golfers sometimes sclaff the ball when they are nervous.
meanings.sent3: The beginner golfer managed to sclaff the ball into the water hazard.
meanings.sent4: Her swing was so off-balance that she could only sclaff the ball weakly.
meanings.sent5: The golfer's attempt to hit the ball ended in a sclaff that barely moved it.

meanings.definition: A poor golf shot in which the club strikes the ground before making contact with the ball.
meanings.sent1: The sclaff resulted in a disappointing start to his game.
meanings.sent2: She felt embarrassed after her sclaff in front of the other players.
meanings.sent3: The loud sclaff made everyone on the course turn to see what happened.
meanings.sent4: The sclaff echoed across the golf course, drawing attention to his mistake.
meanings.sent5: His frustration was evident after the loud sclaff of his club hitting the ground first.
